s.text: One of the worst features of American politics is the way we treat decent people who fail to win elections.
By offering "electability" as his chief selling point, Alexander helped make the case for Bush.
But that's no reason to despise a candidate who tried hard, played fair, and will surely make a gracious exit.
But that's no reason to despise a candidate who tried hard, played fair, and will surely make a gracious exit.
Assuming Alexander's campaign does come to an end next week as predicted, we must ask why it never got off the ground.
